user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_Posix_BinSemAcquireMutex:
```c
int32 OS_Posix_BinSemAcquireMutex(pthread_mutex_t *mut)
{
    struct timespec timeout;

    if (clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &timeout) != 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    timeout.tv_sec += OS_POSIX_BINSEM_MAX_WAIT_SECONDS;

    if (pthread_mutex_timedlock(mut, &timeout) != 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_Posix_BinSemAcquireMutex:
typedef int32_t   int32
...
#define OS_SEM_FAILURE (-6)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_POSIX_BINSEM_MAX_WAIT_SECONDS 2
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code. The function uses only standard C constructs (typedef'd integer type, function definition, pointer parameter, local struct variable, return statements) and calls POSIX library functions (clock_gettime, pthread_mutex_timedlock) and uses POSIX types (pthread_mutex_t, struct timespec). POSIX APIs and types are platform/library features, not compiler language extensions (they are not GCC/Clang/MSC-specific language extensions such as __attribute__, __builtin_*, __asm, typeof, statement-expressions, inline-assembler, or other vendor keywords). There are no identifiers starting with double underscores, no compiler-specific keywords, no asm blocks, no use of GCC statement expressions or typeof, no variable-length array declarations, and no other known compiler-only language extensions present. Therefore there are no code fragments that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
